intro: Elaphrium odoratum, commonly known as the fragrant elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, delicate leaves that emit a subtle, pleasant fragrance. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and aromatic properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal collections.
